OnFileChange.Code: property OnFileChange:TP3DFilePointerOnFileChanged read FOnFileChange write FOnFileChange;

AUserPointer.Comment: Creates a file pointer with the given name. Optionally a user@br

Destroy.Comment: may be stored with the file pointer. The instance of the file@br  pointer is automatically added to the P3DFilePointers var.@br

CheckFileExists.Comment: If the file does not exist the return value is false. The file status is only updated by this function@br  if the DoReload parameter in the callback is set to true.@br

UserPointer.Code: property UserPointer:Pointer read FUserPointer write FUserPointer;

TP3DFilePointer.Code: TP3DFilePointer=class(TPersistent)private FLastFileAge:LongInt;FFileName:String;FOnFileChange:TP3DFilePointerOnFileChanged;FOnFileNameChange:TP3DFilePointerOnFileNameChanged;FUserPointer:Pointer;function GetFileAge:LongInt;procedure SetFileName(AValue:String);public constructor Create(AFileName:String;AUserPointer:Pointer=nil);destructor Destroy;override;function CheckForChange:Boolean;function CheckFileExists:Boolean;procedure Reload;virtual;property UserPointer:Pointer read FUserPointer write FUserPointer;published property FileName:String read FFileName write SetFileName;property LastFileAge:LongInt read FLastFileAge;property OnFileChange:TP3DFilePointerOnFileChanged read FOnFileChange write FOnFileChange;property OnFileNameChange:TP3DFilePointerOnFileNameChanged read FOnFileNameChange write FOnFileNameChange;end;
TP3DFilePointer.Comment: TP3DFilePointer    A pointer to a file which may or may not exist. It is used internally to manage all open files. If Reload is executed the file    status is updated. True is returned if the file changed. If assigned the file changed callback is run.@br

TP3DFilePointerOnFileChanged.Comment: callback is executed if the file on the disk is changed. If do reload is set to True in the callback the file is reloaded afterwards.@br

TP3DFilePointerOnFileNameChanged.Comment: callback is executed if the file name property is changed.@br

CheckForChange.Comment: function AddWatch( AFileName: String; AUserPointer: Pointer = nil ): Integer;@br

FindFileEx.Comment: returned if the file was found. An empty file name is returned if no file with the given name@br  exists. If there is more than one file with the given name only the first is returned.@br

AddSearchPath.Comment: which is checked before the search paths. The path does not have@br  to be in the scope.@br
